japanese: ほとんどの作家は批評に対して敏感である。
english: Most writers are sensitive to criticism.

english: A 5% consumption tax is levied on purchases of most goods and services.

english: The urban population in most developing countries is increasing very fast.

english: Most Japanese eat rice at least once a day.

english: Almost all Japanese boys like to play baseball.

english: Most big Japanese companies depend on exports.

english: In most Japanese companies, only a few executives have a room to themselves.

japanese: ほとんどの男の子は野球が好きだ。
english: Most boys like baseball.

english: Most girls think that they are pretty.

english: I think that most young people like rock music.

japanese: ほとんどの犬は人懐っこいものだ。

english: Almost every tourist carries a camera with him.

japanese: ほとんどの科学者は彼の発見を軽視している。
english: Most scientists think little of his finding.

japanese: ほとんどの家屋が粉々に破壊された。
english: Most houses were destroyed to pieces.

japanese: ほとんどのエレベーターは自動で動く。
english: Most elevators operate automatically.

japanese: ほとんどのイヌが生きています。

english: It will make most Americans uncomfortable if you insist on their accepting expensive gifts.

japanese: ほとんどどの生物にもある最も本能的な行動が子を守ることであり、人間に関してはこうした行動は一生続くのである。
english: The most instinctive act of nearly every creature is to protect its young, and with humans, this response persists for a lifetime.

japanese: ほとんどだれも彼の言葉を信じなかった。
english: Almost no one believed him.

japanese: ほとんどすべての日本人が髪が黒い。
english: Nearly all Japanese have dark hair.

japanese: ほとんどすべての親が子供の教育に心を配る。
english: Almost all parents see to the education of their children.

japanese: ほとんどすべてのイヌが生きています。
english: Almost all of the dogs are alive.

english: During lunch in the hotel dining room, the girl named Stella collapsed, and when Dr. Stewart examined the body he said...

japanese: ポールは最近大変一生懸命勉強します。
english: Paul studies very hard these days.

japanese: ボールは空中高く跳ね上がった。
english: The ball bounced high in the air.

japanese: ボールは丸い。
english: Balls are round.

japanese: ポールは顔を赤らめて横を向いた。
english: Paul blushed and turned away.

japanese: ポールは学校で飛び抜けて魅力のある生徒だ。
english: Paul is by far the most charming boy in our school.

english: Paul's knowledge of creative bookkeeping has been the secret of his ability to get all the staffing he needs.

japanese: ポールは歌手というよりはむしろ作曲家だ。
english: Paul is not so much a singer as a composer.

japanese: ボールは何でできていたのでしょう。何千年も前には、エジプト人はボールを柔らかい革か布で作っていました。
english: What were the balls made of? Thousands of years ago, the Egyptians made balls out of soft leather or cloth.

japanese: ポールはメアリーが財布を盗まれたときは彼女といっしょではなかった。
english: Paul wasn't with Mary when her purse was stolen.

japanese: メアリーの財布が盗られた時、ポールは彼女と一緒ではなかった。
english: Paul wasn't with Mary when her purse was stolen.

japanese: ボールははねて隣の庭へ入ってしまった。

japanese: ポールはとても気持ちのいい男なので、すぐにだれにでも好かれる。
english: Paul is so pleasant a person that everybody likes him at once.

japanese: ボールはそういうふうにはねるもの。
english: That's the way the ball bounces.

japanese: 人生なんてそんなもんよ。
english: That's the way the ball bounces.

japanese: ポールはお金持ちだったが高慢にはならなかった。
english: Paul didn't become arrogant even though he was rich.

japanese: ボールの中にはサラダが少しもない。
english: We have no salad in the bowl.

japanese: ポールの身に何があったのかしら。
english: I wonder what happened to Paul.

english: The number of the chairs in the hall is 80.

english: More guests have come than the hall can hold.

english: The hall was filled with students, many of whom were girls.

english: Paul has three sons. They look very much alike.

english: The ball hit her in the eye.

english: Not only the balls; the bat was also stolen yesterday.

english: Paul's success was a myth.

english: The ball bounced up high.

english: I enjoyed the concert except that the hall was cold.

english: We couldn't figure out what Paul wanted to do.

english: A hole in one is moving on the whole.

english: Just once, I'd like to get a hole-in-one some day.

english: Poland ceased to exist as a nation for 120 years.

english: It is very difficult to handle the bola, but the ancient Incas were very good at it.

english: Paula and I cooked dinner on Sunday.

english: It's fine to set up a web page, just be sure you don't infringe anybody's copyright.

english: The popularity of a web site depends on its content.

japanese: ボーナス全部を買い物と旅行に使ってしまった。

japanese: ボートを時間単位で借りられる。

english: When Hawking graduated from college in 1962, he began studying for a Ph.D. in physics.

english: Boeing's safety experts have joined others in the industry to form an international task force to try to eliminate one particular kind of air crash known as controlled flight into terrain, CFIT.

japanese: ペンや鉛筆は筆記用具である。
english: Pens and pencils are examples of writing tools.

japanese: ベンもその件には関係がある。

japanese: ベンは両手をポケットへつっこんだ。

japanese: ベン・マニーが中心となっているデータ転送分科会は、１９９９年１月１４日にミーティングをします。
english: The working group on data transfer, led by Ben Manny, will hold a meeting on Jan 14, 1999.

japanese: ベン・ジョンソンが言ったように、「君がどんな人間か分かるように話してくれ」
english: As Ben Jonson put it, "Speak that I may see thee."

english: You wash the dishes, Ben.

japanese: ベストプロダクツへようこそ。
english: Welcome to Best Products.

japanese: ベスが農場で楽しまなかったとは驚きです。
english: I'm surprised that Beth didn't enjoy her time at the farm.

japanese: ベスが今ここにいたらな。
english: I wish Beth were here with me now.

japanese: ベスがその貴重な時計を見付けられないと知って、クリスは悲しみを隠せませんでした。
english: Chris could not conceal his sadness when he heard that Beth had been unable to find his valuable watch.

japanese: ベジタリアンなので、できればお肉は遠慮したい。
english: I'm a vegetarian, so I'd rather not have meat, if that's okay.

japanese: ペギーは演劇を見に行かなかったが私も行かなかった。
english: Peggy did not go to see the drama, and neither did I.

japanese: ペーパー・カップの中へとあふれでていく。
english: It overflows into a paper cup.

japanese: ペート先生は百人の人間の前で喋るのが怖い気がした。
english: Miss Pate felt timid about making a speech before a hundred people.

japanese: ベートーベンは偉大な音楽家であった。
english: Beethoven was a great musician.

japanese: ベートーベンは晩年耳が聞こえなかった。
english: Beethoven was deaf in his late years.

japanese: ベートーベンはピアノのところに行き、それに向かって座り、弾き始める。
english: Beethoven goes to the piano, sits down at it, and begins to play.

japanese: ベートーベンはある？
english: Do you have Beethoven?

japanese: ベートーベンの音楽には強い魅力を感じる。
english: I feel a strong attraction to the music of Beethoven.

japanese: ペーターはジェーンを愛している。
english: Peter loves Jane.

japanese: ページをめくりなさい。
english: Please turn over the page.

japanese: ページをめくって下さい。
english: Please turn the page.
